intro: Mentzelia nitens, commonly known as the pale evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant produces yellow flowers that open in the late afternoon and close at night, adapting to the desert environment. Mentzelia nitens has narrow, linear leaves and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. It is often found in arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
